Comments_List: Different techniques to carefully operate both milling and lead machine.
I learned how to machine. I used the lathe and the mill on a weekly basis and learned how to approach and solve machining problems.
Machining Skills
It teaches me how to build steam machine, a very excited project.
I learned how to use milling machines and lathes. I also learned about tolerance and other important aspects of machine shop wor.
Basic mech engineering training. Great stuff!
I learned the basic skills needed to make things in a machine shop.
Learned a lot of machining tips and tricks and got much more comfortable using the mill and lathe machines.
The course is well organized. I don't think it needs to be changed or modified.
I loved this course. It was fun to go to every week and Dave is a great instructor. Strengths: allowed to be independent while working with machinery.
Excellent course!
This course is wonderful. It was one of my favorite parts of the week. Needs no improvement.
No weaknesses. It was a fun course. Learnt a lot, especially for someone who has no background.
It was a very good course and exactly what I expected.

Absolutely. It is fun, engaging, and inspiring learning how to machine yourself. At one point we made a screw and you learn just how much work goes in to making a screw by yourself with these machines (obviously not how it is done on the large scale). Essentially, you gain appreciation for how things are made.
Yes. Very useful training and skills. Interesting class.
Absolutely!

Absolutely take this course if you are at all interested. I was worried that I wouldn't have the time (I was taking 4.5 other credits and am very involved extra curricularly). In the end, since the course didn't have any homework or tests, it was very manageable.
Yes. Best hands on course ever.

This course is zero credits, but it's a lot of fun. You go to Wright lab for three hours a week to mess around with huge machines and hunks of metal, and you learn how to bend them to your will and make high-precision cuts. By the end of the semester, you will have created your own tiny steam engine, which you can and should show off to all your friends until they become sick of your bragging. Oh, and also Dave gives you cookies. What more could you want? Most of the people in this class will be grad students (and most of them are in the chem department), but undergrads regularly take it as well.
Yes, especially if you can see a future in anything machining. The class will give you the tools to be a machining pro and David is very nice and helpful.
